HPSBAS.MI.short_name: HPS BASIC FUND CLASSE Q EUR
HPSBAS.MI.long_name: Pharus Sicav Basic Fund Class Q EUR Shares
HPSBAS.MI.summary: This Sub-Fund established for an unspecified period has the goal of achieving a development in value that leads to a growth in assets, in accordance with the principle of risk spreading. The Sub-Fund, denominated in Euro, invests in various categories of transferable securities (especially in equities, convertible bonds and interest-bearing securities) issued by issuers who appear to be particularly promising in the medium-term from an economic and geographical perspective. The Sub-Fund can invest up to 60% of its net assets in convertible bonds and interestbearing securities with an investment grade credit rating (i.e. minimum Baa3/BBB- (long-term rating) according to recognised rating agents) and up to 20% of its net assets may be invested in non-investment grade convertible bonds and interest-bearing securities.
HPSBAS.MI.manager_bio: Parmeggiani has served as a vice president and head of Eastern European equity research at Vontobel Asset Management- Zurich and Vontobel USA - since September 1997. From 1992 to 1997, he worked for Lombard Odier in Geneva as a portfolio manager and specialist in emerging markets equities.

HPSDYN.MI.short_name: SUMUS STRATEGIC FUND CLASSE Q E
HPSDYN.MI.long_name: SUMUS - Strategic Fund Class All EUR Sub-Class Q cap shares
HPSDYN.MI.summary: This Sub-Fund established for an unspecified period has the goal of achieving the growth of its Net Asset Value over a medium term period, in accordance with the principle of risk spreading. The long-term return target is EONIA (Euro Overnight Index Average) + 250 bps per year. The main source of the return will result from the asset allocation decisions. The global approach of the Sub-Fund is to be flexible, i.e. that the Investment Manager will principally and dynamically allocate asset classes in a portfolio composed of: equities, bonds and convertible bonds (with a maximum of 30% in non-investment grade bonds and convertible bonds), money market instruments, cash and cash equivalents.
